alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman; McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 17 at 6:26PM CDT until June 17 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern Brown County in west central Texas... Southeastern Coleman County in west central Texas... Northeastern McCulloch County in west central Texas... Northwestern San Saba County in west central Texas... * Until 715 PM CDT. * At 625 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Winchell, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Winchell and Mercury around 635 PM CDT. Elm Grove around 645 PM CDT. Skeeterville around 655 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Whon, Milburn, Locker and Indian Creek. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
